2.description: The compound eyes of imagines, separation.

3.description: The compound eyes of imagines, two-lobed or not.

states.1: distinctly two-lobed (the larger, upper lobe usually with larger facets than those of the lower, in which they are usually darker)

4.description: The upper lobe of the compound eyes of imagines, whether turbanate.

5.description: Second antennal segment of imagines and sub-imagines, relative length.

states.1: three times as long as the first
states.2: no more than twice as long as the first

7.description: Wings of imagines and sub-imagines, spotted or unspotted.

states.1: more or less spotted with brown or blackish

8.description: Fore-wings of imagines and sub-imagines, whether veins M1 and Cu1 are strongly divergent.

states.1: with veins M1 and Cu1 strongly diverging basally
states.2: with veins M1 and Cu1 sub-parallel basally (implicit)

9.description: Fore-wings of imagines and sub-imagines, whether veins R4 and R5 detached.

states.1: with R5 detached basally from R4
states.2: with R5 and R4 joined basally (implicit)

10.description: The marginal fore-wing veinlets of imagines and sub-imagines, whether single or paired between the main longitudinal veins.

11.description: Hind-wings of imagines, present or absent.

12.description: The hind-wings of the female imagines, length relative to fore-wings: data recorded only for two-tailed females!

states.1: no more than one fifth the length of the fore-wings
states.2: more than one fifth the length of the fore-wings

13.description: The hind-wing costa of imagines and sub-imagines, smoothly curved or with a projection.

14.description: The fore-legs of imagines, insertion close or distant.

states.1: inserted relatively close together under the thorax

15.description: Hind tarsi of imagines and sub-imagines, length relative to the tibia.

states.1: about one-and-a-half times the length of the tibia (Siphlonurus)

16.description: Hind tarsi of imagines and sub-imagines, number of moveable segments.

states.2: with 4 moveable segments (the fifth, if present, fused to the tibia)

17.description: The first segment of the hind tarsus of imagines, length relative to the second segment.

states.1: about twice as long as the second
states.2: about three times as long as the second

18.description: The hind tarsal claws of imagines, whether both pointed or one blunt and one pointed.

states.2: unalike, being one pointed and one blunt

19.description: The abdomen of imagines, number of tails.

21.description: The lobes of the penis, broad or narrow.

22.description: The lobes of the penis, appendages/spurs.

23.description: The outer tails of nymphs, distribution of hairs.

states.1: hairy (bearing long hairs) on the inner side only

24.description: Gills of nymphs, position on abdomen.

states.1: mostly at the sides of the abdomen
states.2: mostly lying on the upper surface of the abdomen

states.1: all densely fringed with filaments on both sides
states.2: not fringed with filaments on both sides

26.description: Gills of nymphs, whether consisting of a plate with a tuft of filaments.

states.1: mostly consisting of a plate bearing a tuft of filaments
states.2: never comprising a plate bearing a tuft of filaments
